Text: We all need to do our part to reduce #COVID19 stigma ; avoid creating unnecessary social, physical or other harms in our community. Support friends, family members ; people in our community who are impacted by this virus. https://t.co/7kQi68ZOA6

I'm in touch with someone who's on the governors' call with President Trump right now. They and others listening in are alarmed. The president is urging governors to take back the streets, not be "weak," and use force as the nation faces growing racial unrest.

This is eerily symbolic of the Trump Administration. In the midst of multiple crises He turns of the lights in the White House:- Global pandemic with more than 100,000 people dead in the US.- More than 40 million people unemployed - Coast to Coast Protests https://t.co/WKSRJ2yOqI

Educators already adapting to #remoteteaching due #COVID19 now find themselves facing another challenge: supporting, educating, and engaging students during waves of protest and community outrage. How some teachers are responding from @Chalkbeat at https://t.co/CAaoiNI1e6

A new #Ebola outbreak detected in western #DRC, near Mbandaka, Équateur province. @MinSanteRDC has identified 6 cases, of which 4 people have died. The country is also in final phase of battling Ebola in eastern DRC, #COVID19 ; the world's largest measles outbreak.
